trans-unit.source: Represents a scope (namespace) for management operations.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref> class, with default values.
This is the default constructor.
If the object does not have any properties set before connection, it is initialized with default values (for example, the local machine and the root\cimv2 namespace).
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref> class representing the specified scope path.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref> containing the path to a server and namespace for the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref> class representing the specified scope path.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The server and namespace path for the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref> class representing the specified scope path, with the specified options.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref> containing the path to the server and namespace for the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Management.ConnectionOptions"></xref> containing options for the connection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref> class representing the specified scope path, with the specified options.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The server and namespace for the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Management.ConnectionOptions"></xref> containing options for the connection.
Returns a copy of the object.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A new copy of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref>.
Connects this <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref> to the actual WMI scope.
This method is called implicitly when the scope is used in an operation that requires it to be connected.
Calling it explicitly allows the user to control the time of connection.
This method will return within two minutes.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref> is currently bound to a WMI server and namespace.
A scope is disconnected after creation until someone explicitly calls <xref:System.Management.ManagementScope.Connect%2A>, or uses the scope for any operation that requires a live connection.
Also, the scope is disconnected from the previous connection whenever the identifying properties of the scope are changed.
Property Value
`true` if a connection is alive (bound to a server and namespace); otherwise, `false`.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value indicating whether the scope is currently bound to a WMI server and namespace.
Gets or sets options for making the WMI connection.
Property Value
The valid <xref:System.Management.ConnectionOptions> containing options for the WMI connection.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.ConnectionOptions"></xref> that contains the options for making a WMI connection.
Gets or sets the path for the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref>.
Property Value
A <xref:System.Management.ManagementPath> containing the path to a server and namespace.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref> containing the path to the scope (namespace).
Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A new object that is a copy of this instance.
